Strawberry Creme Brûlée

This will make enough for 6, 4 oz. ramekins!

Ingredients:

  • 1/2 carton strawberries - chopped and hulled (remove the leaves and white part)
  • Sugar
  • 1 pint (2 cups) heavy creme
  • 3 large egg yolks
  • Vanilla extract

Directions:

  1. Place strawberries in saucepan and sprinkle 1/2 tbsp of sugar over top
  2. Set over low heat, cover and bring to a simmer
  3. Uncover and continue to cook until a sauce has formed and strawberries are tender
  4. Allow to cool slightly
  5. Slowly whisk in heavy creme to strawberry sauce and return to heat
  6. Cook over medium flame until just scalded, but not boiling
  7. Remove from heat
  8. Preheat oven to 325
  9. Whisk 3 egg yolks, 1/4 cup of sugar and 1 tsp vanilla extract in a large bowl (you’ll need to fit the creme from above)
  10. Slowly whisk in warmed creme mixture into eggs until well incorporated
  11. Distribute mix between 6 ramekins with a ladle to prevent spilling
  12. Place 6 ramekins in a baking dish and fill with water until ramekins are half way under water
  13. Bake in oven 45-60 minutes or until custard is set around edges, but still wobbly in middle
  14. Remove from oven and cool for 10 minutes
  15. Wrap each with plastic wrap and put in fridge for at least 3 hours (up to 3 days)
  16. Remove 30 minutes prior to preparing to serve
  17. Add enough sugar to form a complete thin layer on top of custard
  18. Apply blow torch in a constant circular motion until sugar is bubbling and beginning to brown
  19. Let cool for a moment and serve with strawberry garnish on top
